name: Brief Resilience Scale
description: A 6-item measure assessing the ability to bounce back or recover from stress. It is one of the few resilience measures that focuses specifically on the core concept of resilience.
reference: Smith, B. W., Dalen, J., Wiggins, K., Steger, M., & Lohr, J. M. (2008). The Brief Resilience Scale: Assessing the ability to bounce back. International Journal of Behavioral Medicine, 15, 194-200.
instructions: Please indicate the extent to which you agree with each of the following statements.

questions.name: brs_1
questions.description: I tend to bounce back quickly after hard times.

questions.name: brs_2
questions.description: I have a hard time making it through stressful events.

questions.name: brs_3
questions.description: It does not take me long to recover from a stressful event.

questions.name: brs_4
questions.description: It is hard for me to snap back when something bad happens.

questions.name: brs_5
questions.description: I usually come through difficult times with little trouble.

questions.name: brs_6
questions.description: I tend to take a long time to get over set-backs in my life.
